Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease the cookie sheets.

Cream 1/2 cup of butter and white sugar together until smooth in a medium bowl. Blend in the eggs one at a time, then mix in the vanilla and ricotta cheese. Gradually add and combine the flour, baking soda, and salt to the cheese mixture. Spoon the batter by rounded teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets, with 2 inches of space between each spoonful.

Cream together 1/2 cup butter and sugar in a medium bowl. Mix in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla and ricotta cheese. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and salt mixture into the wet ingredients. Drop spoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheets and bake in the oven for 8 to 10 minutes until edges turn golden. Cool on baking sheet before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Stir the granulated sugar into batter mixture and continue to beat for another minute. Fold in the whipped cream and gently mix until well incorporated. Pour the mixture into a glass pan lined with graham crackers.
